thread.title: Hang onto your mittens, Toronto. It's going to be a frigid week | Toronto Star
thread.title_full: Hang onto your mittens, Toronto. It's going to be a frigid week | Toronto Star

author: thestar.com/blogs.html
title: Hang onto your mittens, Toronto. It's going to be a frigid week | Toronto Star
text:
Bundle up Toronto, as the chilly temperatures are expected to continue. Environment Canada predicts cold lows and flurries the rest of the week. Temperatures will hover around 1 C Wednesday afternoon with partly cloudy skies and a 30 per cent chance of flurries. Environment Canada predicts it may begin to snow lightly Wednesday evening. Overnight, temperatures will dip to -8 C with wind gusting to 40 km/h.
Not too worry if you’re craving for some sunshine. Thursday will bring a mix of sun and cloud, with a high of – 3C and a low at – 10C later in the day
Friday is expected to dip even lower, with the high at – 5 C and getting chillier during the night with a low of –10 C. Temperatures will rise Saturday, with a high of – 2 C. Sunday will bring with it flurries, with a high at 0 C.
